item.title: Fragments of a Dream
item.description: …is a project by Leon Monschauer and Pascal Santaella reflecting the feeling with which a dream sometimes leaves us behind. Somehow lost, somehow incomplete - but stunningly beautiful.

item.title: Good Houdini Resources
item.description: Here you can find some resources that helped me learn and still help me understand all of this better. Blog Style Content Entagma - If you want to understand understanding and also a little bit of Houdini, watch everything they make John Kunz- Crazy talented guy.

item.title: Good Redshift Resources
item.description: Here you can find some resources that helped me learn and still help me understand all of this better. YouTube Channel Content BlueFox Creation - not only Redshift, but very good to learn some oddly specific use cases with Redshift .

item.title: WIP - We are just getting started
item.description: If you are reading this you’ve arrived before the knowledge. Maybe come back later and see, if we’ve added some content.

item.title: Creating and adding a widget to the viewport
item.description: This may be basic but you may tend to forget to do this, so I’ll link this everywhere wehave to do it - sorry! Creating a Widget To start, let’s just create a Widget Blueprint via right-clicking ...

item.title: Pascal wants to add
item.description: What I need to tell you Interpolation notes in Unreal (fInterp Playground) Fixing the Unreal Engine VR Template Editor Utility Widgets for Batch Renaming and other File Stuff Building ...

item.title: Practically using fInterp and vInterp to make a widget follow our mouse (with smooth interpolation)
item.description: Would be great if you could just tell a Widget to go where you want it to go - and it would just work? Well, we’ll do exactly that. Interp your way to the top Lets start simple by Creating and adding a widget to the viewport Then, we’ll drag and drop an Image Widget into our Canvas Panel.

item.title: How to dejitter simulated lines (and draw them in the first place)
item.description: This is WIP - We are just getting started. I will add images, videos and project files later, as I’m currently writing this on my phone. This note is a rather funny one as the problem started nondescript: Prolog I was working on a project where the art director requested a drawn line, that is able to grow and dance on the floor.

item.title: How to overcomplicate a website or how I set this blog up
item.description: I started using Obsidian a few years ago for note taking. As I wanted to sync with my phone and computer and couldn’t spend the money, I set up a repo in GitHub and used that for the time being.
